revised_title: Chromosome Structure and Gene Expression: The Role of Scaffold-Associated Regions
tldr: The article discusses the relationship between chromosome organization and gene expression. It explores scaffold-associated regions (SARs) and their role in the structure and function of chromatin loops. The study finds that specific SARs are present near regulated genes and that topoisomerase II, a major component of the scaffold, plays a crucial role in chromosome organization and gene expression.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Genetics and Epigenetics
